segments.text: It ’ s so great to be here ! I ’ m so excited to help you and my daughter with your new home !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We ’ re glad that you ’ re here . Would you like a tour of the house ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ d be great , but could I have a cup of tea first ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure , I ’ ll just go put the kettle on . Why don ’ t you have a seat on the sofa and I ’ ll go take care of things in the kitchen .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you take milk or sugar with your tea ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ ll take a little milk , but no sugar , please . Make sure you let the tea steep a few minutes before you take the tea bag out of the cup .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok . What do you think about our living room ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I do like the mantelpiece and the coffee table , but I don ’ t really care for curtains . Did you get them at a yard sale ? They look ancient .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My parents gave them to us as a house warming gift .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh dear . Well , I suppose they will do for now . do you ever dust in here ? It seems a bit dusty in here .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your daughter usually does the dusting , and I do the vacuuming .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Well , I can help with the chores while I ’ m here . You two could probably use my help .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s very nice of you to offer . Here ’ s your tea . Be careful , it ’ s still quite hot .
segments.speaker: S2
